# INBO report with RMarkdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple syntax to format text. Markdown documents can be rendered to different output formats: e.g. PDF, HTML, ePUB, Word, ... More information on R Markdown is available at <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

The output style `inbo_rapport_2015` renders the document as a PDF with the INBO corpate identity. An MS-Word version can be rendered by using the output style `word_document`. Note that this will be a simple MS Word document, not rendered into the INBO corpate identity.

When you push the **Knit** button in RStudio, all R code in the document will be executed and it's output will be inserted into the document. Then the complete document is rendered using the selected output style. You can find an R code chunk below this paragraph. Adding a new code chunk is easy in RStudio by pressing `Ctrl + Alt + I`.

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Adding figures

Adding R figures is easy:

```{r pressure, echo = FALSE, fig.cap = "The caption"}
ggplot(pressure, aes(x = temperature, y = pressure)) + 
  geom_point()
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` argument was added to the chunk options. This hides the R code that generates the figure. The `fig.cap` argument adds a caption to the figure.

## Adding tables

`pandoc.table()` is a handy function to display dataframes as a table. Note that we need the argument `results='asis'`.

```{r, results='asis'}
pandoc.table(
  pressure,
  caption = "The caption of a table"
)
```
